Name: Marvin's Last Word
Ingredients: 22.5 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lime zest twist.
Express lime zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: The distinctive notes of mastiha and Chartreuse shine in this Greek riff on the classic Last Word .
History: Created by Christos Chouseas at 42 Bar in Athens, Greece – a bar where The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy and the work of Douglas Adams influences many of the drink names. In The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy book, the number 42 is the "answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything", while 'Marvin' is a paranoid, depressive android. See also Last Word history
Nutrition: One serving of Marvin's Last Word contains 171 calories
